DOCNAME: CASE OF PADURET v. THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA AND RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions;Article 1 para. 2 of Protocol No. 1 - Control of the use of property);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions;Article 1 para. 2 of Protocol No. 1 - Control of the use of property)
JUDGES: Dmitry Dedov;Jon Fridrik Kjølbro;Julia Laffranque;Paul Lemmens;Ksenija Turković
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The background to the case , including the NORP armed conflict of DATE and the subsequent events , is set out in ORG and Others v. GPE and GPE ( [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL ) and ORG and Others v. GPE and GPE ( [ ORG ] , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL others , § § DATE , ORG DATE ( extracts ) ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , who is an entrepreneur , was transporting merchandise to an agricultural market in the town of NORP in the self - proclaimed “ GPE ” ( the “ FAC ) . He was stopped by CARDINAL persons presenting themselves as customs officers of the “ FAC who seized his van and the merchandise contained therein on account of his having allegedly failed to register the vehicle . On DATE the “ FAC ” customs authority issued a decision obliging the applicant to pay a fine of QUANTITY ( ORG ) in return for being able to recover his van and merchandise . The applicant paid the fine .

CARDINAL . In the meantime the applicant complained to the authorities of GPE about the seizure of his van and merchandise . On DATE the Dubasari prosecutor ’s office initiated a criminal investigation into the facts of the case and several suspects were declared wanted . However , the investigation was suspended in DATE .
